com.k2.Util

Class DateUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.k2.Util.DateUtil

  • public class DateUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility provides static method for handling Date values.
    Author:
    simon

      This enumeration identifies the default data formatter

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.text.SimpleDateFormat dateFormatter()
      This method returns the current date formatter Defaults to "yyyy-MM-dd"
      static java.text.SimpleDateFormat dateFormatter(DateUtil.DateFormat format)
      This method returns the current data formatter for the given date format
      static void dateFormatter(java.text.SimpleDateFormat newDateFormatter)
      This method set the current date formatter to the given formatter This formatter will be used if the utility is defined to format dates into date only format
      static java.text.SimpleDateFormat dateTimeFormatter()
      This method returns the current date time formatter Defaults to "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:SS"
      static void dateTimeFormatter(java.text.SimpleDateFormat newDatetimeFormatter)
      This method set the current date time formatter to the given formatter This formatter will be used if the utility is defined to format date into date time format
      static void defaultDateFormat(DateUtil.DateFormat newDefaultFormat)
      This method defines whether the default date format should be date only or date and time Defaults to date and time
      static java.text.SimpleDateFormat defaultDateFormatter()
      This method returns the current default date formatter according to the default date format
      static java.util.Date nvl(java.util.Date checkValue, java.util.Date valueIfNull)
      This method converts null values
      static java.util.Date random()
      This method returns a random date
      static java.util.Date random(java.util.Date from, java.util.Date to)
      This method returns a random date between within the defined range.
      static void registerTypeConverter(TypeConverter<?,java.util.Date> converter)
      This method registers with this static utility an instance of a date TypeConverter to convert an instance of the convertible class into a date value
      static void restoreDefaults() 
      static java.lang.Boolean toBoolean(java.util.Date v)
      This method converts the given date value into a Boolean
      static java.util.Date toDate(java.util.Date v)
      This method converts the given date into a Date
      static java.util.Date toDate(java.lang.Object v)
      This method converts the given object into a Date value Static utility methods convert Strings, Integers, Longs, Floats, Doubles, Dates and Booleans into Date values If the given object is not one of the above types then a type converter must have been registered with this static utility in order for the given object to be converted into a Date value If no type converter has been registered for the class of the given object then a null is returned
      static java.lang.Double toDouble(java.util.Date v)
      This method converts a date into a Double
      static java.lang.Float toFloat(java.util.Date v)
      This method converts the given date into a Float
      static java.lang.Integer toInteger(java.util.Date v)
      This method converts the given date value into an Integer
      static java.lang.Long toLong(java.util.Date v)
      This method converts the given date value into a Long
      static java.lang.String toString(java.util.Date v)
      This method converts the given date into a String using the current default formatter
      static java.lang.String toString(java.util.Date v, DateUtil.DateFormat format)
      This method converts a given date into a String using the current formatter for the given format
      static java.lang.String toString(java.util.Date v, java.text.SimpleDateFormat dateFormatter)
      This method converts the given date into a String using the given formatter
      static java.lang.String toString(java.util.Date v, java.lang.String format)

        Returns:
        The date formatter for the given date format

      • defaultDateFormat

        public static void defaultDateFormat(DateUtil.DateFormat newDefaultFormat)
        This method defines whether the default date format should be date only or date and time Defaults to date and time
        Parameters:
        newDefaultFormat - The new default format to use

      • registerTypeConverter

        public static void registerTypeConverter(TypeConverter<?,java.util.Date> converter)
        This method registers with this static utility an instance of a date TypeConverter to convert an instance of the convertible class into a date value
        Parameters:
        converter - The date TypeConverter instance

      • toDate

        public static java.util.Date toDate(java.lang.Object v)
        This method converts the given object into a Date value Static utility methods convert Strings, Integers, Longs, Floats, Doubles, Dates and Booleans into Date values If the given object is not one of the above types then a type converter must have been registered with this static utility in order for the given object to be converted into a Date value If no type converter has been registered for the class of the given object then a null is returned
        Parameters:
        v - The object to convert into a Date value
        Returns:
        The Date representation of the given object or null if the given object is null or the class of the given object cannot be converted into a date value

      • toInteger

        public static java.lang.Integer toInteger(java.util.Date v)
        This method converts the given date value into an Integer
        Parameters:
        v - The date to convert
        Returns:
        An integer value representing the given date

        Parameters:

        to - The end of the date range

      • nvl

        public static java.util.Date nvl(java.util.Date checkValue,
                                 java.util.Date valueIfNull)
        This method converts null values
        Parameters:
        checkValue - The value to check for null
        valueIfNull - The value to return if the value to check is null
        Returns:
        The checkValue if it is not null else the valueIfNull
